title: Build error: bcftools@1.3.1
body:
installing bcftools@1.3.1 fails with "autotools.py runtime error"

This seems to be version specific as installing bcftools@1.6 works just fine.

### Expected Result

Expected clean build

### Actual Result
```
==> Installing bcftools
==> Fetching <mirror_dir>/bcftools/bcftools-1.3.1.tar.bz2
==> Staging archive: <build_dir>/var/spack/stage/bcftools-1.3.1-wk23abdncjz4szmz2wlsrarhyi4sku7g/bcftools-1.3.1.tar.bz2
==> Created stage in <build_dir>/var/spack/stage/bcftools-1.3.1-wk23abdncjz4szmz2wlsrarhyi4sku7g
==> No patches needed for bcftools
==> Building bcftools [AutotoolsPackage]
==> Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> Error: RuntimeError: Cannot generate configure: missing dependencies ['m4', 'autoconf', 'automake', 'libtool']
RuntimeError: RuntimeError: Cannot generate configure: missing dependencies ['m4', 'autoconf', 'automake', 'libtool']

<build_dir>/lib/spack/spack/build_systems/autotools.py:200, in autoreconf:
     7             missing = [x for x in autotools if x not in spec]
     8             if missing:
     9                 msg = 'Cannot generate configure: missing dependencies {0}'
  >> 10                raise RuntimeError(msg.format(missing))
     11            tty.msg('Configure script not found: trying to generate it')
     12            tty.warn('*********************************************************')
     13            tty.warn('* If the default procedure fails, consider implementing *')

See build log for details:
  <build_dir>/var/spack/stage/bcftools-1.3.1-wk23abdncjz4szmz2wlsrarhyi4sku7g/bcftools-1.3.1/spack-build.out
```
